extendedInfo.description: To help healthcare providers explain AFib to patients, their families and caregivers, AF Stat has developed the AFib Educator. This app provides healthcare professionals with an interactive resource to help illustrate how AFib can affect the heart; visually demonstrate the symptoms, risks and management strategies of atrial fibrillation (AFib); and where patients can learn more.â¢   Detailed animated, color diagrams of the heart under normal rhythm and during AFibâ¢   Fluoroscopy (x-ray) images of the heart in and out of rhythm, featuring the heart's electrical impulseâ¢   EKG readings with normal heart rate and with AFibâ¢  AFib management animations: demonstrates the effects of different management strategies for a heart in AFib, including:       o	Rate control       o	Rhythm controlâ¢  AFib risk animations:        o	Stroke risk animation:shows an AFib-related stroke to illustrate that a blood clot can travel from the heart to the brain as a result of AFib       o	Remodeling process animation: depicts the remodeling process, which is a result of untreated AFib that affects the shape and size of the heartâ¢   Facts about the signs, symptoms, prevalence and risks of AFib can be shared through the "E-mail a Friend" featureâ¢   Links to resources where patients can learn more about AFib

reviews.title: That\'s it!
reviews.comment: That is exactly how it feels too. I\'ll show my doctor this.  I could never find the words to tell him hours it feels. This will show him for me.  Thanks dev team.
reviews.author: Mike Dorsey

reviews.title: Patients love it!
reviews.comment: I use this to educate  patients on afib. Positive feedback from all of them. Some have downloaded it to their iphones & droids. It has helped them visualize afib & understand the importance of med compliance. Wish they had this on their website.
reviews.author: Amanda Malchick

reviews.title: GREAT Educator Tool
reviews.comment: What an AWESOME tool to have for educating people about this subject matter.  This is the type educational tools we need more of.  This makes our high priced communications devices worth having.
reviews.author: Bob Rogers

reviews.title: Short
reviews.comment: This is a nice common way of showing a new protime patient what Atrial Fib is.  Before using it however, I would recommend asking your supervisor.
reviews.author: JaLayne Hawkins

reviews.title: Thank you
reviews.comment: Thank your brother Richard P for this download. I am very glad he brought this to my attention. I am a student at COTC.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Makes AF so simple to explain
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Thank u so much
reviews.comment: Very very good and useful app
reviews.author: Pjitra Eve

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Helped some of the family members understand what was \'going on\'.
reviews.author: Larry B
